intro: Myginda pallens, commonly known as the pale myginda, is a species of flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, lance-shaped leaves with a pale green hue. Its flowers are white or pale yellow, often clustered in panicles, and emit a subtle fragrance. Myginda pallens is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments at high altitudes.
